objects.name: BreakOutPhysicsExplain
objects.string: Using physics, better collisions and more realistic movements

objects.name: BreakOutExplain
objects.string: Uses the bounce extension to simulate bounces, doesn't use the physics

events.comment: ExampleWaterMark's style is set to italic to match GDevelop's logo. Also an shadow is also given to text to match the game's style
The button animations
The pitch of the sound made when the button is clicked is set to 100. Making it sound different that the original sound

objects.name: StartCard_Sub_title
objects.string:
This is a GDevelop example for BreakOut
Use A and D (or the left and right arrow key) to move the paddle
Red bricks take 3 hits
Yellow bricks take 2 hits
White bricks take 1 hit

Powerups randomly fall

events.comment: This example recreates the classic breakout example. This uses the bounce extension and also a custom extension called BatBounce. Go to the "search new extensions" click import extension on the bottom left and select the .json file that has the custom extension if you want to import a custom extension. You don't have to do this as the extension has already been imported into this example
The EndCard is hidden , the barrier is hidden. A variable for checking the ball and paddle's size is used as the sizes are changed using a tween, making it unreliable when the tween is taking place
The RandomBlockCreator cretes a random block layout and gives them a random health (0-3) at the start of the scene.
The GUIManager contains all the events related to the button, text, etc...  BlockUpdate manages the block's health, etc..

The paddle has a top-down movement behavior attached to it. The paddle is moved when a and d are pressed. The paddle's movement is limited to the screen size by the barrier. So, that the paddle doesn't go out of the screen.
The Paddle size/width scale is clamped in the allowed range

A custom extension called BatBounce is used for bouncing the ball off the paddle. This lets the player aim unlike the normal bounce extension.  The OnFireConter of ball is set to 0, making OnFIre deactivate when a ball hits the paddle
The OnFire counter is set to 0 only after checking if the OnFire is greater than 5, so that particles are always deleted, and so that OnFire doesn't get deactiavted before the Partcle is deleted
The normal bounce extension is used for the Barrier and the Blocks
Avoid the ball getting stuck. So, that it won't go back and forth in the same direction
The Paddle size is clamped in the allowed range

Each ball has a OnFireCounter and a Strength (There can be multiple ball when multi-ball is activated). The Health of the block is decreased by the value of variable Strength of ball. The Strength is how much damage the ball is do to the block (Default: 1). The Strength is set to 2 when OnFire is activated. The OnFireCounter is also increased. The  Block's Height Scale is checked so that the ball doesn't collide with a block that is being tweened (A tween is played when the block dies)
The animation/colour of the blocks are changed according to it's health. 1is subtracted as the animations are arranged in the way so that Health = 1: animation = 0, Health = 2: animation = 1, etc..
The block's scale is tweened to 0 when it's health <= 0. The object is then deleted (The option for deleting the object when tween has finished is activated)
The power up is randomly chossen when the ball hits a block. There is also a chance that nothing drops
There are extra conditions for creation of the Power up so that powerups don't get created when the limit is reached (Ex: The lifes are full )
Lifes
Bigger Paddle
Smaller Paddle
Bigger Ball
Smaller Ball
Multi-Ball
The number of balls that can be activated at once is limited to 5
A sound is played when the powerup hits the paddle and that powerup is deleted. Then, the needed changes to the game are made according to the powerup
There are extra conditions for the activation of the Power up so that powerups don't get activated when the limit is reached (Ex: The lifes are full )
The size of paddle and the ball are tweened so that the animations feel smooth
Don't forget to add the tween behaviour to the objects that will be tweened. Or it won't work
The PowerUp is deleted using the DestroyOutSideScreen behavior if the player doesn't catch the powerup
When multi-ball is activated, a ball is created at the PowerUp. Force is applied so that it bounces off the paddle, And the Scale of Ball is set to Variable BallSize in case a powerup is activated
The powerup is deleted so that it doesn't get activated again
OnFire is an object variable as not all balls can be OnFire when multiple balls are activated

OnFire is activated when the variable OnFireCounter of ball is greater or equal to 5. The value of OnFireCounter is increased every time the ball hits a block without hitting the paddle. OnFire gives makes the ball do more damage to the blocks
The emitter force and the particle's size is  increased every time the ball hits more blocks
The particle's it's angle is set to the opposite of the ball's movement. Acting like a trail

There are 4 game states:

NotStarted: The game hasn't started
GamePlay: The game is being played
Lost: The game was lost
Won: The game was won
The GameState is set to "NotStarted" when there are no balls left and Lifes left is more than 0 (So that it doesn't get activated when the game was lost )
If no balls are left, a new one is created and it's scale is set to BallSize (Incase a power-up is activated)
The Ball is always on top of the paddle, letting the player aim at the start
When Space is released, the ball is given the force to a random direction between 30-100 with the speed of 400
The same layer is used for both the Won and lost layer. Only the title is changed
The PreStartCard is hidden when game's state is "GamePlay", GUI layer is show so that the player can view their stats
When the lifes left is 0 the GameState is set to "Lost"
When the blocks left is 0 the GameState is set to "Won"
The GUI layer is hidden  and the ball is stopped if the GameState is not "GamePlay". That is, if the State is Won, Lost, NotStarted, it would hide the GUI Layer and stop the ball

The animation of life counter is set to the Lifes left (Variable Life). The animations are arranged in a way so that health = 0: animation = 0,health = 1: animation = 1, etc... So, the animation is directly set without any conditions

When the Y position of the ball is greater than 1440 (The resolution of the screen) meaning that the ball is outside the screen. The Life is reduced by 1 and the GameState is set to "NotStarted" (If only one ball is left), giving the player another chance
The OnFireParticle is deleted if OnFIre is activated, so that the particle doesn't get attached to other balls

objects.name: StartCard_Sub_title
objects.string:
This is a GDevelop example for BreakOut
Use A and D (or the left and right arrow key) to move the paddle
Red bricks take 3 hits
Yellow bricks take 2 hits
White bricks take 1 hit

Powerups randomly fall

events.comment: This example uses the Physics 2 engine to create the classic breakout game. The bouncing and collisions are handled by the engine
The EndCard is hidden , the barrier is hidden. A variable for checking the ball and paddle's size is used as the sizes are changed using a tween, making it unreliable when the tween is taking place
The RandomBlockCreator cretes a random block layout and gives them a random health (0-3) at the start of the scene.
The GUIManager contains all the events related to the button, text, etc...  BlockUpdate manages the block's health, etc..

the paddle is a dynamic physics object and is moved using forces. The paddle is moved when a and d are pressed. The paddle's movement is limited to the screen size by the barrier. The collision between the barrier and the paddle is handled by the physics engine
The Paddle scale/width scale is clamped in the allowed range

As the paddle is an dynamic physics object with it's gravity scale set to 0, it can be moved if high forces are applied. With this events, the paddle can't rotate or move on the y axis (Top to bottom)
The ball bounced off by the physics engine.  The OnFireCounter of ball is set to 0, making OnFIre deactivate when a ball hits the paddle
The OnFire counter is set to 0 only after checking if the OnFire is greater than 5, so that particles are always deleted, and so that OnFire doesn't get deactiavted before the Partcle is deleted

Avoid the ball getting stuck. So, that it won't go back and forth in the same direction. The physics engine doesn't have an expression/condition to check the angle of the force of an object (Here, it is the ball). So, we use some maths to get the angle of movement from the velocity on each axis. The calculation returns a negative value for reflex angles (greater than 180). We can't use negative angles as we need to calculate if the movement is -170 and 170 (190 and 170) that is > -170 and > 170, it won't work. So, we use the absolute value of the angles to find the angle
The ball is given a force when it is too slow
The ball's linear damping is increased when it gets too fast
The Ball's scale is clamped in the allowed range

Each ball has a OnFireCounter and a Strength (There can be multiple ball when multi-ball is activated). The Health of the block is decreased by the value of variable Strength of ball. The Strength is how much damage the ball will do to the block (Default: 1). The Strength is set to 2 when OnFire is activated. The OnFireCounter is also increased. The  Block's Height Scale is checked so that the ball doesn't collide with a block that is being tweened (A tween is played when the block dies)
The animation/colour of the blocks are changed according to it's health. 1is subtracted as the animations are arranged in the way so that Health = 1: animation = 0, Health = 2: animation = 1, etc..
The block's scale is tweened to 0 when it's health <= 0. The object is then deleted (The option for deleting the object when tween has finished is activated)
The power up is randomly chossen when the ball hits a block. There is also a chance that nothing drops
There are extra conditions for creation of the Power up so that powerups don't get created when the limit is reached (Ex: The lifes are full )
Lifes
Bigger Paddle
Smaller Paddle
Bigger Ball
Smaller Ball
Multi-Ball
The number of balls that can be activated at once is limited to 5
The powerUp is a dynamic physics object. So, the powerUp is moved down by the physics engine
A sound is played when the powerup hits the paddle and that powerup is deleted. Then, the needed changes to the game are made according to the powerup
There are extra conditions for the activation of the Power up so that powerups don't get activated when the limit is reached (Ex: The lifes are full )
The size of paddle and the ball are tweened so that the animations feel smooth
Don't forget to add the tween behaviour to the objects that will be tweened. Or it won't work
The PowerUp is deleted using the DestroyOutSideScreen behavior if the player doesn't catch the powerup

When multi-ball is activated, a ball is created at the powerUp. Force is applied towrads a random point in the paddle so that it bounces off the paddle, And the Scale of Ball is set to Variable BallSize in case a powerup is activated.
The powerup is deleted so that it doesn't get activated again
OnFire is an object variable as not all balls can be OnFire when multiple balls are activated

OnFire is activated when the variable OnFireCounter of ball is greater or equal to 5. The value of OnFireCounter is increased every time the ball hits a block without hitting the paddle. OnFire gives makes the ball do more damage to the blocks
The emitter force and the particle's size is  increased every time the ball hits more blocks
The particle's it's angle is set to the opposite of the ball's movement. Acting like a trail

There are 4 game states:

NotStarted: The game hasn't started
GamePlay: The game is being played
Lost: The game was lost
Won: The game was won
The GameState is set to "NotStarted" when there are no balls left and Lifes left is more than 0 (So that it doesn't get activated when the game was lost )
If no balls are left, a new one is created and it's scale is set to BallSize (Incase a power-up is activated)
The Ball is always on top of the paddle, letting the player aim at the start
When Space is released, the ball is given the force to a random direction towards the paddle with the speed of 0.1
The same layer is used for both the Won and lost layer. Only the title is changed
The PreStartCard is hidden when game's state is "GamePlay", GUI layer is show so that the player can view their stats
When the lifes left is 0 t, the GameState is set to "Lost"
When the blocks left is 0 the GameState is set to "Won"
The Physics behavior is deactivated so that the ball doesn't move

The animation of life counter is set to the Lifes left (Variable Life). The animations are arranged in a way so that health = 0: animation = 0,health = 1: animation = 1, etc... So, the animation is directly set without any conditions

When the Y position of the ball is greater than 1440 (The resolution of the screen) meaning that the ball is outside the screen. The Life is reduced by 1 and the ball is deleted.  And if no balls are left, the GameState is set to "NotStarted"
The OnFireParticle is deleted if OnFire is activated, so that the particle doesn't get attached to other balls
All the text objects are given a shadow to match the game style
The text of score is set to Variable Score
The button animations
The pitch of the sound made when the button is clicked is set to 100. Making it sound different that the original sound
The pitch of the sound made when the button is clicked is set to 100. Making it sound different that the original sound
CurrentGameScene() makes it chnage to the current scene, restarting the game
There are 3 block objects, which will have different health/color (The color of the block is set according to the block's health) at the start of the game

The variables brick1color, brick2color, brick3color is set to a random number from 1-3. A external layout (Which has the block layout) is randomly created by adding a random number from 1-5. The external layout that matchs that randomly generated name is created
The Health of the blocks is set to the variable brick1color, brick2color,brick3color and it's animation is set accordingly

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.

This *won't work* with Physics engine or Platformer characters. This is working with objects that are moved using actions or behaviors using **the forces**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Bounce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Bounce

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOff

events.comment:
To bounce the object realistically, we first separate it from the obstacle. The collision engine will do it by moving the object through the shortest "normal vector" of the edge that was collided.
We store the position of the object before being moved so that we know the angle of this "normal vector". Once we know it, we add a force in the direction of the normal vector, and we add the difference between the normal vector and the previous angle of movemement.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: None
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Send the object back and set a direction opposed to the bat center to allow the player to aim.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BatBounce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Send the object back and set a direction opposed to the bat center to allow the player to aim.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Send the object back and set a direction opposed to the bat center to allow the player to aim.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: BatBounce

eventsFunctions.description: Send the object back and set a direction opposed to the bat center to allow the player to aim.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOff
